dialogue: Doctor: Where is this lesion located on your body?
Patient: This lesion is located on my face, specifically on my cheek.
Doctor: What color do you think this spot is?
Patient: I think this spot is pinkish-red.
Doctor: How big do you estimate this spot to be?
Patient: I estimate this spot to be about the size of a pencil tip.
Doctor: Can you describe how this spot feels when you touch it?
Patient: When I touch this spot, it feels rough and uneven, like a small bump or a callus.
Doctor: Is there more than one of these spots?
Patient: Yes, there are multiple spots on my skin that look like this.
Doctor: Does the edge of this spot look smooth or rough?
Doctor: Do you feel any discomfort in this area?
Patient: No, I don't feel any discomfort in this area.
Doctor: How often does this spot appear?
Patient: I've noticed this spot a few times over the past few months. It seems to come and go.
